channel.title: Is this computer any good?
channel.description:
Lenovo H520s 57311128 Desktop PC: $499.99 Intel® Core™ i3-2130 3.4GHz Dual-Core CPU 4GB DDR3 1333MHz Memory 1TB SATA 7200RPM Hard Drive DVD±R/RW Optical Drive Intel® HD 2000 Graphics 5.1 Channel Audio 7-in-1 Media Card Reader Gigabit Ethernet Network 802.11b/g/n Wireless Network 6xUSB2.0, 1xVGA, & 1xHDMI Microsoft® Windows® 8 64-bit McAfee AntiVirus Plus 2012 (30 Day Trial) 180W Power Supply 15.75" x 11.54" x 3.94" & 19.5 lbs. Lenovo Slim USB Keyboard & Optical USB Mouse

item.title: Is this computer any good?
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

[quote=“SilentCJ, post:21, topic:479380”][quote author=jal knight link=topic=597617.msg4207974#msg4207974 date=1359182901]
fk it im buying a ps3
[/quote]
Wouldn’t bother, next gen coming at E3 this year (June)[/quote]
Which means the prices are about to drop on the others. Im not the type of person that wants the newest and badest things tho so I’ll just wait until the new generation isnt “the coolest” anymore before I get it.

I am getting taxes around feb 15-20. So I figured if I got a refurbished ps3 plus assasins creed 3 and battlefield 3 ill be happy for a while.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this computer any good?
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“Jmood, post:16, topic:479380”][quote author=rip4d link=topic=597617.msg4207629#msg4207629 date=1359155157]
That computer may not lag for Runescape granted its on fixed graphics and around minimum settings. If you really want decent gaming performance, upgrade that power supply to about 400W (which isn’t expensive, maybe $40 max) and a low end graphics card, unless you’d like to play games a step above HL2 engine games. I have this card in my computer and it runs Runescape and most games such as Garry’s Mod and Portal 2 nicely. Plus it was only $40 when I got it, so for a budget its a pretty nice deal. Its also good if you have a slim computer, especially if you get stuck with a weaker power supply (220w works fine for this card, but if you have a slim case and can’t get a micro power supply better than that, just find and stick with a 220w)
[/quote]

Are you talking about my build? I have a 760w PSU… Plus I have a far superior graphics card to the one you just posted, I also didn’t use a slim case. The case I have in this build is the same one I use and it’s great I haven’t even filled it up yet… :P[/quote]noooooooooo I’m talking about what his computer should be… I want your build lmao

Read full topic

item.title: Is this computer any good?
item.dc:creator: @jal_knight jal knight
item.description:
@jal_knight wrote:

I think what I have decided is to try and negotiate with the guy trying to sell me one. I dont need 1tb HDD, 300gigs is more than enough. an i5 would be okay for me and maybe a radeon hd for the g card.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this computer any good?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

rip4d:

That computer may not lag for Runescape granted its on fixed graphics and around minimum settings. If you really want decent gaming performance, upgrade that power supply to about 400W (which isn’t expensive, maybe $40 max) and a low end graphics card, unless you’d like to play games a step above HL2 engine games. I have this card in my computer and it runs Runescape and most games such as Garry’s Mod and Portal 2 nicely. Plus it was only $40 when I got it, so for a budget its a pretty nice deal. Its also good if you have a slim computer, especially if you get stuck with a weaker power supply (220w works fine for this card, but if you have a slim case and can’t get a micro power supply better than that, just find and stick with a 220w)

Are you talking about my build? I have a 760w PSU… Plus I have a far superior graphics card to the one you just posted, I also didn’t use a slim case. The case I have in this build is the same one I use and it’s great I haven’t even filled it up yet…

Read full topic

item.title: Is this computer any good?
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

That computer may not lag for Runescape granted its on fixed graphics and around minimum settings. If you really want decent gaming performance, upgrade that power supply to about 400W (which isn’t expensive, maybe $40 max) and a low end graphics card, unless you’d like to play games a step above HL2 engine games. I have this card in my computer and it runs Runescape and most games such as Garry’s Mod and Portal 2 nicely. Plus it was only $40 when I got it, so for a budget its a pretty nice deal. Its also good if you have a slim computer, especially if you get stuck with a weaker power supply (220w works fine for this card, but if you have a slim case and can’t get a micro power supply better than that, just find and stick with a 220w)

Read full topic

item.title: Is this computer any good?
item.dc:creator: @Fridder Fridder
item.description:
@Fridder wrote:

[quote=“jal knight, post:12, topic:479380”]I was just wanting to play games like Rs with out any lag from high graphics and Gary’s Mod which runs off of Falf Life engine.

I’m not in to the newer games with the graphics that seem so real you can touch them.
I’d like to get the better deal but who knows.

go to http://www.technowizards.biz/Desktops.html and tell me which one of them would be the best deal for the best price. (if you dont mind)
Im not looking to spend more than 600
Thanks for all the replys![/quote]

[quote=“chillwitm888, post:5, topic:479227”]just put shit in the case, building pc these days are dummy proofed
its basically like putting lego together, you just can’t screw it up unless
you have uncompatible mobos psus and/or not big enough case
here: i will include a 500$ build
without the OS: http://pcpartpicker.com/p/zcot
it accumulates to around 462$ there will be no hardware issues, if you do it right
with the OS (win 7 home premium) (Lower specs but does the job):
http://pcpartpicker.com/p/zcxb
491$
I think those are the best you can get for less than 500$[/quote]

If you really want windows 7 (no warez) pm me and I can help you out for free.

Read full topic

item.title: Is this computer any good?
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

I would pick neither, but if those are your only two choices pick the i3. It is hyper-threaded (or whatever the hell Intel calls it), and the integrated graphics will perform a little better than the Pentium.
